name: XDR Test 1
desc: Verifies the ability of the sending system to initiate a SOAP-based communication with an XDR-based payload.  The XDR metadata used in this test case is: Limited.

name: XDR Test 2
desc: Verifies the ability of the sending system to initiate a SOAP-based communication with an XDR-based payload.  The XDR metadata used in this test case is: Full (XDS).

name: XDR Test 3
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to correctly receive a properly formatted XDR message with Limited metadata.  (Default attachment is a Consolidated CDA document.)

name: XDR Test 3 -- HITSP/C32
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to correctly receive a properly formatted XDR message with Limited metadata.  Attachment is a HITSP/C32 document.

name: XDR Test 3 -- CCR
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to correctly receive a properly formatted XDR message with Limited metadata.  Attachment is a Continuity of Care Record.

name: XDR Test 4a
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message.  This case is of an invalid SOAP header.

name: XDR Test 4b
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message.  This case is of an invalid SOAP body.

name: XDR Test 4c
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message.  This case is of a missing Direct Address Block.

name: XDR Test 4d
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message.  This case is of missing XDR metadata.

name: XDR Test 4e
desc: The Tester shall return an error when an incorrect XDR message, such as missing associations between ebRIM constructs, is received from the ETT (HISP)

name: XDR Test 5
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to correctly receive a properly formatted XDR message with Full (XDS) metadata.

name: XDR Test 6
desc: Verifies the ability of the sending system to complete a mutual TLS handshake before data is sent across.

name: XDR Test 7
desc: Verifies the ability of the sending system to reject a mutual TLS connection where the certificate provided by the ETT is invalid.

name: XDR Test 8
desc: Verifies the ability of the receiving system to complete a mutual TLS handshake before data is sent across. Certificates for this test can be downloaded from the link at the top of this page.

name: XDR Test 9
desc: Verifies the ability of the receiving system to reject a mutual TLS connection where the certificate provided by the ETT is invalid. Certificates for this test can be downloaded from the link at the top of this page.

name: XDR Test 10
desc:
Test Tool sends a Direct Message, which is translated to an XDR message and sent to the Edge.
Verify that the HISP system can create an XDR message per the specification and forward to Edge.

name: XDR Test 11
desc:
Test Tool sends a Direct Message + XDM, which is translated to an XDR message with Limited Metadata and sent to the Edge.
Verify that the HISP system can create an XDR message per the specification and forward to Edge.

name: XDR Test 12
desc:
Test Tool sends a Direct Message + XDM, which is translated to an XDR message with Full Metadata and sent to the Edge.
Verify that the HISP system can create an XDR message per the specification and forward to Edge.

name: XDR Test 13
desc:
Test Tool sends an XDR Message to the HSIP which then translates the message to Direct and sends to the other HISP.
Verify that an HISP system can receive a properly formatted XDR message and translate to Direct Message.

name: XDR Test 14
desc:
Test Tool sends an XDR Message with Full Metadata to the HSIP which then translates the message to Direct and sends to the other HISP.
Verify that an HISP system can receive a properly formatted XDR message and translate to Direct Message.

name: XDR Test 15a
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message. This case is of an invalid SOAP header.

name: XDR Test 15b
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message. This case is of an invalid SOAP body.

name: XDR Test 15c
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message. This case is of a missing Direct Address Block.

name: XDR Test 15d
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message. This case is of missing XDR metadata.

name: XDR Test 15e
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a malformed message.  This case is of malformed/inconsistent XDR metadata.

name: XDR Test 16
desc: Verify that Mutual TLS session is established between the Sender and the Receiver before transimitting data.

name: XDR Test 17
desc: Verify that HISP disconnects when the Server provided certificate is invalid.

name: XDR Test 18
desc: Test Tool authenticates with the HISP using Mutual TLS correctly. Certificates for this testing tool can be downloaded from the DIRECT portion of the website, which is accessible from the main homepage.

name: XDR Test 19
desc: Test Tool authenticates with the HISP using bad certificates. Certificates for this testing tool can be downloaded from the DIRECT portion of the website, which is accessible from the main homepage.

name: XDR MT Test 19
desc: Verifies the ability of the sending system to send messages with unique message-IDs. The sending system will send three messages with unique identifiers to the endpoint provided.  (Message Tracking using Processed MDN.)

name: XDR Test MT 20a
desc: Verifies the ability of the sending system to initiate an XDR transaction to ETT and to receive a process MDN.  The test lab will inspect the SUT’s logs and system to verify that the process MDN was handled appropriately.

name: XDR MT Test 20b
desc: Verifies the ability of the sending system to initiate an XDR transaction to ETT and to receive a failure MDN.  The test lab will inspect the SUT’s logs and system to verify that the process MDN was handled appropriately.

name: XDR MT Test 30
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately handle a valid  delivery notifications request, including X-DIRECT-FINAL-DESTINATION-DELIVERY data.

name: XDR MT Test 31
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately handle a invalid delivery notifications request, including X-DIRECT-FINAL-DESTINATION-DELIVERY data.

name: XDR MT Test 32
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a potential delivery to a non-existent address.

name: XDR MT Test 33
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a potential delivery to an untrusted HISP.

name: XDR MT Test 34
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond to a potential delivery to a HISP whose certificate is unpublished.

name: XDR MT Test 35
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond in the event of a lack of a Processed MDN.

name: XDR MT Test 36
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond in the event of a lack of a Dispatched MDN.

name: XDR MT Test 37
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond in the event of a message timeout failure.

name: XDR MT Test 38
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond in the event of positive delivery notification

name: XDR MT Test 43
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately provide a delivery failure message if it is unable to deliver the message to the destination.

name: XDR MT Test 44
desc: Verify the ability of the receiving system to appropriately respond in the event of a message timeout failure.

name: XDR MT Test 48
desc: Verify the ability of the sending system to send messages with unique message-IDs.  The sending system will send three messages with unique identifiers to the endpoint provided.  (Message Tracking Using "Implementation Guide for Delivery Notification")

name: XDR MT Test 49
desc: Verify the ability of the sending system to correctly use a direct address block per the section 4.0 XDR and XDM Messaging for Direct v1.0 and per section 1.3 of the "Implementation Guide for Delivery Notification for Direct v1.0".

name: XDR MT Test 50a
desc: Verify the ability of the sending system to correctly handle the case of sending XDR messages to valid recipients.

name: XDR MT Test 50b
desc: Verify the ability of the sending system to correctly handle the case of sending XDR messages to invalid recipients.
